messages.subject: Re: What are your favorite unschooling blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: ... You can find the list of blogs I follow on my profile. Most of them are unschooling, but I have a some friends who range between eclectic and classical
messages.messageBody:
> ***I am having fun looking at the multitude of unschooling blogs out there and would love to hear what you are finding to be your favorities?***

You can find the list of blogs I follow on my profile. Most of them are unschooling, but I have a some friends who range between eclectic and "classical" home learners and I've included them, too.

I've also got a sidebar on my blog with some of my favourite unschooling blogs listed. These are my current favourites. I do tend to add to and delete from this list in a very unfaithful way... it just depends on my current mood (and who's keeping up on their blogging).

My own blog is all over the place and is really for my mother (heh) and friends/family, so I'm not sure it qualifies as an "unschooling" blog. You can find the link on my profile if you are interested in taking a peek.

http://www.blogger.com/profile/01180832647715611790

> Sandra's blog is neat because her blog roll lists recently updated blogs. (wish I knew how to do that!)

Hey, Jenny, you can do that through your blogger dashboard. Go to "Layout" and then choose "Add a Gadget". Choose "Blog List" and then add your favourite blogs. You can choose how much info shows up on your sidebar. On my blog, I choose just the blog's title and the title of the latest post. And I choose to list them according to recently updated instead of alphabetical order. Have fun. :) :)

- Rebecca

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] What are your favorite unschooling blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: ***I am having fun looking at the multitude of unschooling blogs out there and would love to hear what you are finding to be your favorities?*** This is
messages.messageBody:
***I am having fun looking at the multitude of unschooling blogs out there and would love to hear what you are finding to be your favorities?***

This is mine... I have a few of my favorites listed however I haven't updated my favorite list in a while so some vital one are missing! Blog of the Zombie Princess is a great blog with a cool blog roll. Sandra's blog is neat because her blog roll lists recently updated blogs. (wish I knew how to do that!)

http://jenniferstar.blogspot.com/

I'm doing a "unschooling is..." continuation post. If others want to join in, you could comment with a link to your own "unschooling is..." post on any relevant ones that I've posted thus far, or something new that strikes your fancy!





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: What are your favorite unschooling blogs?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all! I am having fun looking at the multitude of unschooling blogs out there and would love to hear what you are finding to be your favorities?  I trying to
messages.messageBody:
Hi all!

I am having fun looking at the multitude of unschooling blogs out there and would love to hear what you are finding to be your favorities? I trying to put together a list of the best blogs out there. My criteria is unschooling blogs that have been around for a while and post often and are up to date. There are some fun reads out there. Any thoughts?

Adam Dealande
unschool dad, yelm wa
